logic

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Player contains all the information of a game player

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Board board
      player's board, initially empty, later with the players ships
      private int liveShips
      number of live ships of the player
      private java.lang.String name
      name of the player
      private int number
      number of the player (1 or 2)
      private Board opponent
      player's idea of the opponent's board, with the player's guesses
      private java.util.Vector<Ship> ships
      vector with pointers for the player's ships

    • Constructor Summary

      Instantiates a new Player

      • shipOverlaps

        private boolean shipOverlaps(int shipIndex)
        Checks if a given ship overlaps any other ship of the player
        Parameters:
        shipIndex - index of the ship we want to check
        Returns:
        boolean true if there is some overlap with the given ship, false otherwise

      • autoPlaceShips

        void autoPlaceShips(java.util.Random random)
        Randomly places the player's ships
        Parameters:
        random - random number generator Note: the ships are not placed on the board, only their information is altered

      • manualPlaceShip

        boolean manualPlaceShip(int shipIndex,
                        Position position,
                        boolean orientation)
        Sets the position of a player's ship
        Parameters:
        shipIndex - index of the ship whose position we want to change
        position - position of the board where we want to place the ship
        orientation - orientation vertical or horizontal for the ship
        Returns:
        boolean true if the position is valid, false otherwise

      • changeShipPosition

        boolean changeShipPosition(Position oldPosition,
                           Position newPosition,
                           boolean newOrient)
        Changes the position of a player's ship
        Parameters:
        oldPosition - current position of the board where the ship is
        newPosition - position of the board where we want to place the ship
        newOrient - intended orientation for the ship
        Returns:
        boolean true if the change is valid, false otherwise

        Returns:
